issues.description: The `Person` class’s `birthday` attribute is declared as `LocalDate` in the template/common code and per the problem specification, but in the solution/common `Person.java` it is declared as `String`. This cross-artifact mismatch conflicts with the UML (which specifies `LocalDate`) and will confuse students when modeling and serializing dates.
issues.suggested_fix: In the solution’s common `Person.java`, change the `birthday` field and its getter/setter to use `LocalDate` (import `java.time.LocalDate`) so it matches the template and UML specification.

issues.description: Within the solution code, `PersonScene` treats `birthday` as a `LocalDate` (calling `DatePicker.setValue(person.getBirthday())` and passing `DatePicker.getValue()` directly to `Person.setBirthday()`), but the solution’s `Person` class defines those methods to use `String`. This internal mismatch will cause compile-time errors.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the solution’s `PersonScene` to convert between `String` and `LocalDate` (e.g. using `LocalDate.parse()` and `toString()`), or—preferably—change the solution’s `Person` class to use `LocalDate` for `birthday`, matching the view code.
